Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: E30pedro
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to stay at this great inn while traveling to Los Angeles for work recently. It's a small place, situated in a great neighborhood. The staff were all very warm and helpful, especially with their knowledge of local places. It's walking distance to a number of great dining options on San Vicente. I especially enjoyed the breakfast and snacks that they offered. The rooms were vey clean and modern. I'll definitely go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: angnic
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 3 nights at The Brentwood Inn & absolutely loved it. What a gem, a lovely change from large hotels. Staff were fantastic, we were welcomed every morning with a smile & lovely complimentary breakfast. Staff were very helpful with their local knowledge, from Pizza ordering to where to catch the local buses as we didnt have a car. Room & bathroom very clean & comfortable. Our son loved the cookies & milk in the afternoon! Location was great, would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: JaneK66
Reviews.Content: After spending ages searching for somewhere to stay in LA (with parking), I finally came across the Brentwood Inn and chose it because of the good reviews it had. I wasn't disappointed. We received such a warm welcome when we arrived and all the reception staff were very friendly and helpful and told us places to visit etc. They have different types of teas and cookies in the reception that you can help yourself to in the afternoon and evening, and the breakfast (included in the price) was very nice - fruit, cereals, yoghurt and pastries etc, and you can sit in the little courtyard and eat it. One of the big benefits was the free parking and you can park right outside your room. The rooms have been very nicely renovated and are very comfortable and spotlessly clean. It's located in Brentwood which is a nice suburb. You really need a car if you're staying here. It's well located for driving out to the coast, eg Malibu, Santa Monica, Venice Beach etc, and also for driving into Hollywood, Beverly Hills and downtown. We really loved this hotel and would stay there again if we go back to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in LA!”
Reviews.Author: Smoofoo500
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! Felt very comfortable. Short walk to Brentwood Village (where there are excellent resturants) and located in a safe area. Short car ride to Santa Monica and to other popular attractions. Excellent service, complimentary breakfast pastries in the morning and cookies in the evening. Very clean and modern decor. Excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “how to feel "welcome"”
Reviews.Author: bidibodi
Reviews.Content: what a lovely little place, cosy and nice, with real people who care for you and make you feel a welcome guest The room was neat and clean and very neatly refurbished, at the beginning I was worried about the traffic running so nearby but there has been not a single noise issue. A laid back atmosphere which I found very relaxing and quite conveniently located to the beaches and to brentwood shops and cafes Continental breakfast is included and with LA weather you can enjoy it in the little garden near the reception

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: taniaimran
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel in febuary 2012 for 3 nights. Good place, a little pricey though but very comfortable. The rooms are individual chalets and are nicely done. Parking is free in this inn. Generally, THE distances in LA are quite a bit so you need to have a car to commute around LA. So if u have a car than this place is great, but no public transportation is very near since this hotel is in residential area.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant accommodation”
Reviews.Author: melanie u
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Brentwood inn for a couple of nights stopover on our way home from NYC. The service was fantastic, the staff are extremely friendly and helpful,the rooms were a good size and the bed very comfortable. Just as an extra personal touch there is not only breakfast provided each morning but also cookies and milk each afternoon. Close proximity to Santa Monica, which has both shopping and dining available as well as the Santa monica Pier. Would highly recommend this to anyone looking to stay in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: McTavish_11
Reviews.Content: I liked staying here, the staff were really helpful - when I asked about something they didn't know about, they got back to me in the morning with the information I needed. You need a car to get about if you stay here, but even if you don't you can get into Hollywood by bus - there's a bus stop just outside. I stayed there for three nights, and sadly the trip was wrecked by wet weather, but I would have no qualms about recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Value in Pricey L.A.”
Reviews.Author: DMilo46
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Brentwood Inn and we were as favorably impressed as the first time. The rooms are clean and well-maintained, the staff is friendly and helpful and the continental breakfast is more than enough to satisfy almost anyone. Since we were last there, they've added free WiFi and big screen tvs, but the ongoing popularity of this small hotel (and the dificulty in getting a reservation) is adequate testimony to its excellence. We'll be back. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient launching pad”
Reviews.Author: deepcover
Reviews.Content: The Brentwood Inn is a very convenient motel, and since a light breakfast and parking are included the value is good. The staff are all extremely friendly, efficient and helpful. The location is handy to the freeway and very close to the beautiful Getty Museum. The rooms are plain but clean and there is no noise between rooms. However there is a lot of noise from the road, and the fire station is across the street, so there can be sirens at all times of the night. This can be alleviated if you leave the A/C on low all night, but we did get awakened a lot the first night even though our room was close to the back. We walked to the farmer's market on Sunday which was only about five blocks away, but most restaurants/shopping are a good 15-20 minute walk away. I think this hotel is a good one if you're going to be doing a lot of driving to different parts of L.A., but not if you want to hang around the hotel or neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, quiet Inn”
Reviews.Author: Sue0419
Reviews.Content: this was our second stay at this inn. The location was convenient for visiting relatives. It is clean, quiet, and has a nice breakfast. Owners are very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Family owned and old fashioned customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Travel4us22
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this small old style hotel. You park your car in front of your room here, and as other reviewers have said, the rooms and bathrooms are small compared so some other chain hotels. Just a few miles from UCLA, this family owned hotel has the nicest staff and they go out of their way to make your stay perfect. As we had an very large truck to bring my mother in law's scooter, they gave us a small stepping stool with a "reserved" sign to hold one of the larger parking spaces in front of our room while we were gone. This was so helpful in terms of getting a space we fit in as well as one that allowed an easy loading of an elderly lady! The rooms are very clean, comfortable and the breakfast is just perfect for us. You can get coffee and tazo teas in the lobby any time and you will always be greeted with a friendly smile. Don't miss the breakfast patio with the lovely fountain just off the lobby, a nice relaxing spot on a sunny morning. There is a bit of traffic on Sunset Blvd. it was not a problem for us, and quieter than other hotels we have stayed in that are closer to the freeways in this area. I felt the rates were very reasonable for Brentwood and the great location of this charming motel!

Reviews.Title: “Just right!”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoTraveler47
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I thought we would give it a shot. This is a well done renovation of little motel probably from the '50's. The linens, toiletries, colors were nice. Although the room was on the small side, the ceilings were high which made it seem bigger. The front staff was great! They came up with an itinerary for our day to explore the area - spending a lot of thought on it and writing everything down for me. This is a great place to stay to visit the Getty Museum. It is close and you don't have to access the highway to get there.

Reviews.Title: “I hestitate to write this review . . .”
Reviews.Author: VickiD
Reviews.Content: Surely this is one of the best kept secrets in LA. I stayed here recently while on business and it was one of the nicest hotel experiences I have had in the city. The small rooms were very clean, tastefully decorated, quiet and very comfortable. Refrigerator was stocked with complimentary bottled water. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Breakfast on the outdoor patio was charming. The location and neighborhood can't be beat, with the lovely shops and restaurants of downtown Brentwood nearby. The price was an amazing $154 a night. i will stay here now whenever I return to LA!

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our choice”
Reviews.Author: TKARCAROLA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Brentwood for four nights. The neighborhood is lovely.The room we stayed in was small but spotless and tastefully decorated. Breakfast was better than average.The outdoor patio was attractive. The front desk help were enthusiatic and helpful. All the employees were consistently great with directions and recommendations in the area.The inn is located on a busy corner, but it quiets down at night and doesn't interfere with sleep. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: Bucky64
Reviews.Content: We were returning to the Rose Bowl but did not want to be constrained by a package tour. We wanted to stay on the westside of LA. I found this motel on TripAdvisor. It offers so much for a very reasonable price. In addition to a clean, well furnished room, it includes free parking and a very tasty continental breakfast. The entire staff was very friendly, co-operative and informative. They had a brown-bag breakfast waiting for us at 4:45 in the morning to take to the Rose Bowl parade. They also provided information regarding some excellent nearby restaurants as well as nearby places to tour including the Getty Museum. If we return to LA in the future, we would definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: AI1978
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Brentwood Inn in early January 2012. Rooms are on the small side but clean and with a cosy, studio like feel. Best feature is the possibility to park your car right at your rooms door as the property used to be a motel. Location in Brentwood is great for all areas between Santa Monica and Hollywood. Service is very friendly and helpful. Maybe breakfast could offer a bit more of variety, but this wouldnt keep me from staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MStrachan2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real find - very helpful staff, clean and modern rooms and all in a lovely location - fully recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Charming small hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: TadeuArc
Reviews.Content: Very nice bed and breakfast style hotel located close to the Interstate in the residential and charming neighborhood of Brentwood. The room is a little bit small, but well furbished and decorated. Breakfast is simples, with little stuff like milk, croissants and fruits only. The staff is a differential, very nice and helpful. Probably it’s one of LA hotel option with best cost x benefit relation.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat the Location”
Reviews.Author: Patricia A
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the Christmas Holidays. This inn is a great find. The location really can't be beat. We were blessed with having spectacular weather our entire stay so walking down to San Vincente was a joy. The inn recommended Pizzicotto for our Christmas Eve dinner and it was delicious. Not having to pay for parking in Los Angeles in a good neighborhood is a real plus. I enjoyed starting my day by taking my morning coffee and speaking with the friendly front desk staff. Our room was clean and stylish. My only complaint was that the mattress on my bed could have been softer. Other than this minor discomfort, I will most likely return when I visit LA again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Guy B
Reviews.Content: Motel basic but very clean modern room (but no door to bathroom), great TV, front desk staff could not have been more helpful. Walk into Brentwood 15 / 20 minutes, area feels safe. Car park can get busy. Would stay here again, just be aware it's a motel not hotel so no on site restaurant / bar etc.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish comfortable stay on a busy LA boulevard.”
Reviews.Author: gwh_SF
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Brentwood Inn for one night while visiting friends in Santa Monica. Pros: - Rooms are small but well appointed, clean, well laid out, and comfortable. Several touches, including pictures, high ceilings, furnishings, give the rooms character and style that seems unusual. - Price. For LA, the Brentwood seems like an excellent value. - perks. Cookies and milk at 4pm. Bottled water in in-room fridge. Breakfast (Costco pastries, fruit, yogurt, coffee). Cons: - noise from Sunset. If you're a light sleeper, this could be a problem. Overall, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Small town warmth in LA metropolis. And great location!”
Reviews.Author: samthefish06
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights in November for a business trip - and I highly recommend the hotel for business and pleasure alike. The hotel came highly recommended by locals and TA reviewers, and the pricing was very reasonable for LA. Prior to arriving, I had read all of the positive reviews and thought I knew exactly what to expect - but I was even more impressed once I began my stay. The hotel is located in the beautiful residential neighborhood of Brentwood - very safe all around, and conveniently located within short driving distance of places to eat, shops, and tourist areas such as Santa Monica. The rooms are tastefully furnished in a modern style, as pictured in the various photographs. I agree that the hotel may have been a motel in its previous existence, but the renovation has been done tastefully, preserving some of the old-style aspects with modern finishings. The rooms are clean, airy with high ceilings, and very comfortable, and perfect for my stay. The rooms and bathrooms are indeed on the smaller side (my room for example only had a shower no tub) - but I wonder if anyone would spend all day in their rooms, and so the size was not an issue for me. The continental breakfast was perfect - featuring pastries, some fruits, coffee, tea, and juice - and available until 11am every day, great for late-risers. The staff are amiable and pleasant, and fulfill the 'home away from home' feeling. Huge kudos to Evan at the front desk, who really made my stay even more special. Evan is very welcoming, and helpful, and it was wonderful to see him at the front desk every day when I went to get my breakfast! Parking can be challenging if you have a really large car, such as an Escalade or very large SUV (I have a regular-size SUV and had no issues). If the lot is full, there is on-street parking available, and I would feel comfortable leaving my car there as the neighborhood is very safe. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is considering a trip to LA for either business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: ian h
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming stayed for our 1st 2 nights in la ,very helpfull friendly staff booking meals in local restraunts etc then called again on our return to la you wont find a better place to stay than here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: Ellen B
Reviews.Content: I just returned from LA and I got to say that The Brentwood Inn is a fabulous place to stay. The staff is friendly, accomodating and courteous. The rooms are perfect....comfortable, clean, well appointed and the decor is elegant. I loved having my breakfast in the little garden. The location is great...a nice neighborhood right in the middle of downtown LA and the beaches of Santa Monica...close to the Getty Museum. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a place to stay in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, nice location, friendly staff, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: 2fast4u2
Reviews.Content: Brentwood is a nice neighborhood, upscale houses, close to santa monica, twenty minutes from hollywood boulevard and very close to the beautifull Getty museum. As mentioned in most other reviews very friendly staff, nice rooms, reasonable prices. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “elegant, warm and very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Phyllis84_11
Reviews.Content: A beautiful little hotel, wonderful clean and classic yet modern room. Perfectly situated on one of the main roads into hollywood, but far enough out of the hustle bustle. Some wonderful restaurants including an italian just 10mins walk away. Coffee and breakfast bits available in the morning. very enjoyable with a warm and friendly service!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: ange1971
Reviews.Content: The Brentwood Inn is a fantastic place to stay. Its in a really nice little suburb of LA with a supermarket and restaurants/cafes only a short distance away (by car). The rooms are small but stylishly furnished and clean. Breakfast in the courtyard was a very relaxing way to start the day. Free Wi-Fi and parking are also huge bonuses. If we ever visit LA again we would definitely stay at The Brentwood Inn and will recommend to friends and family when they visit LA.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rubenfrijns
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very nice, not too big, rooms. They are clean and well cared of. The rooms have AC, shower (the one we had), toilet, LCD tv, fridge and a nice bed. The staff is very friendly en helpfull in giving directions or answer any questions you have. We had a room which laid a bit to the back and outside there were some seats with tables. And someone lit the candle on the tables every evening. That was quite nice when walking to the room. Breakfast was included and it was always fresh and could be enjoyed in your room, inside the lobby or outside the lobby on a small patio. From here it's about 20 minutes to Hollywood, and you are right next to Beverly Hills, Bell Air and a short drive from Santa Monica.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and great location.”
Reviews.Author: PeanutButter27
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here with our young daughter and found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are spotless even though a little small but equipped with all the necessities. The cookies & milk in the afternoons and complimentary breakfast in the lovely courtyard was great. It's in a great location and a short drive to Santa Monica and all the main attractions. The parking does tend to fill up after dinner but we still managed to get a space evry night of our stay and we were out until late every night. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Inn”
Reviews.Author: suel13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just one night during a business trip and it was a very good experience. The staff were really nice and very helpful, and the room was really quaint and nice. It's a pretty small Inn and small parking lot but the location is great and the rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Living history on Sunset Blvd.”
Reviews.Author: avb
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Brentwood Inn on a recent sightseeing trip to LA. It's especially worth it if you love the history of LA since it is right on Sunset Blvd, and is essentially a reclaimed and renovated old style motel or motor lodge, appropriate given the importance of the automobile to the city. A little basic in amenities, especially the bathrooms which have what might be the original 40's fixtures, it's stills very comfortable place to stay. Rooms are small but smartly furnished, and as many others have commented, the staff is superb. They are all 5 star! It's a very convenient place to stay if you are visiting either Getty museum. Great local restaurants, but skip the hotel breakfast-( wasted calories, bad coffee and inedible fruit) and go to one of the local patisseries instead.

Reviews.Title: “I just loved everything and will be back with my husband for sure!”
Reviews.Author: JuArosi
Reviews.Content: The whole staff, specially Evan and the manager, was simply extraordinary, fabulous people! I don't have enough words to claim here how thoughful, understanding and generous they were. Since the day I started the process of booking on line (about 6 months prior to my stay) to the final minute of my stay, these people gave me tons of attention, helped me with everything I needed (specially when I had very upsetting issues with the friends - former friends now - I was traveling with) and made me feel a really special person/customer. I'll never forget it! They are way beyond good service and respect for the customer! Everyone at the front desk always smiling and in a good vibe! Other aspects: The rooms are totally renovated and extremely pleasant, clean and ecofriendly. Housekeeping is great - all towels and linens super clean and new. The hotel itself is not that big (like other chain hotels) that's why it is so charming and peaceful, completely renovated. Parking and wireless internet included in the rate was fenomenal! Neighborhood is gorgeous, exclusive, so expect paying accordingly - although rates are very nice too, specially for such a wonderful experience. In summary, I can't help thanking these guys in every opportunity I have because they made a huge part of my so positive and vibrant experience in LA. I'll definitely go back (solo or with my beloved husband)! When in LA, stay at the Brentwood Inn! :)

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Global_Village_4_U
Reviews.Content: I recommend highly against this hotel. Do not stay there - I had a terrible experience there and especially with the owners who are beyond unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “The most fantastic staff ever. I will certainly go back”
Reviews.Author: Mikkelskriver
Reviews.Content: The service at The Brentwood in was superb. The staff were extreamly kind and were helpfull when booking restaurants, visiting beaches and it was very clear that they were at work for our sake. The room were nice, a bit small though but decorated with nice paintings and so on. The location near Beverly Hills was perfect. Near the beach in a lovely quiet neighbourhood. Every afternoon there was fresh baked cookies, milk, te and coffee. Beside that there was free fruit 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: JanR3068
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this lovely boutique hotel. Staff is great, the bed is wonderful. The rooms are small, but nicely appointed. Be sure you ask for a room away from the street when you book. Parking is a big negative. If you come in late at night, it can be a challenge if someone is a parking space hog. Had to park around the corner. Think that tthey should police the parking when people pull in. The entire lot is visible from the office. Other than that, would have given it a 5! The cookies and tea in the afternoon in the lobby are a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “slightly over rated”
Reviews.Author: gene g
Reviews.Content: Although the reviews as well as mine are primarily positive I shall introduce some areas which need work. The parking lot is small and congested if someone is picking you up, we had to park a block away and walk to the motel. Access to parking is only off of Sunset which is extremly busy. I was told to Back out onto Sunset which seemed dangerous to me. The shower was very tight and the water was hard to control,either to hot or cold. the soap dish was ok if you are very tall. The staff is very nice and polite and the motel is very clean. I asked for a quiet room and when I arrived I was given the first room located close to Sunset which was a little noisy,yet there were several empty rooms in the back of the motel. The breakfast is very good as well as the afternoon snack. I am only making these comments to help the managment make the motel even better. Over all I would stay there again and feel it is a good value considering the area. The beds were very comfortable as well as the pillows, but I emailed a question to the motel after our stay I recieved no response. Again this overall is a very positive review and if you are in the Brentwwod area I would recommend this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we'd have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: amandaglasgow_01
Reviews.Content: I booked this Inn going on the recommendations on TripAdvisor. It was probably the best service I've ever received by a hotel (and I've stayed in lots!). It was small and cosy but very clean and comfortable. The onsite parking was great as you could park right in front of your room. The rooms were reasonably spacious - good bed which was well needed after a long 10hr flight. The room amenities were excellent although there is no in-room safe but they have them at reception if you need it but this is outdone by the hairdryer - a must if I may say so and my travel one didn't work well so this was fab. The breakfast pastries/yoghurt were great and you could just get a tray and take it back to your room, or sit in the little sunny patio area. The Inn was right on Sunset Boulevard (and not too far from I405) so very handy for getting around. We ate in Brentwood Village most nights, which was closeby and had a good selection of restaurants. Probably not the best hotel if you don't have a car but I loved it Each of the reception staff were great - nothing ever seemed a hassle and they were really friendly and very very helpful with any requests we had - pointing out locations of key attractions when we checked in and helped with tour bus times/tickets etc. I would have no hesitation in recommending this Inn and hope to go back to explore more of LA so would definitely be back to The Brentwood Inn!

Reviews.Title: “the place to be on the west side”
Reviews.Author: neirots n
Reviews.Content: convenient location, clean and confortable rooms, very nice and empathetic staff, very close to UCLA, santa monica and pacific palisades. Laura and I stayed there for 5 nights during a conference at the UCLA. only con: the rooms close to sunset boulevard are a little bit noisy. however, it fully deserves the high ranking in LA. highly recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Beacon17
Reviews.Content: The Brentwood Inn was a great location for my visit to Southern California. I have been to Los Angeles many times, and I was primarily there to visit friends and family. Brentwood is close to Santa Monica, so my husband and I went there several times during our stay. It is also close to freeways and not far from LAX. The Getty Museum, the Getty Villa and Hammer Museum at UCLA are close, so it is great location for art lovers. My husband and I wanted to stay somewhere quiet, so it was perfect for us. The Inn is located in a quiet residential neighborhood. (There is a busy road right next to the Inn, but we didn't hear it in our room.) If you are looking for nightlife, this is not the right neighborhood. The room was very clean and nicely decorated and the staff was friendly. The WiFi worked great. Breakfast was included and there is an enclosed patio next to the reception area where you can eat outside. My only complaint was the selection at breakfast could have been better. There were muffins and pastries, but they were too sweet. The only thing I could eat there was instant oatmeal. My husband and I are used to eating very healthy food, so it would have been good to have some whole grain breads and cereals, organic yogurt, etc. It is California after all! There is a Whole Foods nearby and some restaurants in Brentwood. Overall the Brentwood Inn is a nice place to stay at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay if you travel with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: BuenosAiresPaula
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled with our three teenage kids. Although our queen deluxe room was not much on the space side it was really comfortable. And our kids` room was huge and with its own private patio ! People at the reception were all very helpful and they provided us really useful information for our trip. We were so comfortable that we decided to lenghten our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, cosy hotel - had everything we needed.”
Reviews.Author: pjmac123
Reviews.Content: The Brentwood Inn delivered on first impressions. We arrived in the dark and the overall feel of the place with the fairy lights on etc. was a welcome introduction. The hotel room provided everything we needed - fridge, Air Con, Hair Dryer, Iron. The decor was modern and tasteful and the room was a cosy place to be. A simple breakfast was provided every morning which was just enough to get the day off to a good start. Staff were helpful and we had the use of free wifi for the duration of our stay. The location of the Brentwood Inn is quite far from all the things we wanted to do, but then again, LA is SO HUGE that everywhere is miles away from everywhere else! In that respect the Brentwood is in a good location as it's between Santa Monica (about 15 minutes drive south-west) and Beverley Hills/Hollywood (about 30 minutes drive east). The one thing I would advise if you're going to drive in LA is AVOID THE FREEWAY. if you have GPS with you, take an alternative route and let it navigate you from there. The FREEWAY is a nightmare and is so busy it will delay you by hours. The hotel provides free parking which is ideal. Also, if you're travelling to or from LAX airport, The Brentwood Inn is ideal as it's only a 10 minute drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Readeverynight
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel in a residential district. The accommodations were better than I expected for the reasibable rate posted on Hotels.com. There were lots of small very nice touches. The various young men who manned the front desk were fiendly and willing to do anything they could to help. There was a Macintosh laptop in the lobby to use to check e-mails. There always had coffee, cookies, and tea available in the lobby free of charge. Parking was off street and free. On the grounds there were two quiet outdoor spots for sitting in the shade and reading. The room was as clean as clean could be. My wife and I enjoyed our stay, and we did not mind having to drive a few blocks to downtown Brentwood for our meals. We even had the added treat (while we were eating outside at the Cheesecake Factory) of seeing Dustin Hoffman try to work an ATM. He started over at least half a dozen times, and I am not sure whether he ever go this money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent relation rate-service”
Reviews.Author: RegiaAna
Reviews.Content: Cozy motel, excellent location (Brentwood, Beverly Hills), extremely friendly and helpful staff. Great to be on the go all day long and have a clean, comfortable room at night. Don't expect anything fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot and lovely staff!”
Reviews.Author: Perks_on_tour
Reviews.Content: The Brentwood is a great little Inn in a residential area. This is not a fancy place but it has a certain chicness with good attention to detail. The person who booked us in was very helpful printing off maps and recommendations for meals. The breakfast was a simple affair but very good quality-loved the charming little courtyard with a water feature to pacify the weary soul! We found the area safe and pleasant to walk around in (restaurants are a good 15 min walk away but down a nice plant lined neighbourhood) This area is good for Hollywood and the beaches and we travelled and parked ok everywhere (albeit at a cost at Venice beach). We loved the place and will definately stay on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Corvos
Reviews.Content: An older place that's been modernized nicely, this was a real find in LA. There's no restaurant or pool, just a pleasant place to stay. It made a perfect base for what we wanted to do and see, and one very nice room feature was enough light to read by! Refrigerator, iron, hairdryer provided. They handed us bottled water on arrival and there was more in the refrigerator which was a thoughtful touch, they obviously are trying very hard to make people welcome and we liked that a lot. Good location, comfortable, clean, charming, nice staff. We enjoyed our stay very much and we'll be back. They offered milk and cookies in the late afternoon and a continental breakfast (basic but fresh and good coffee) in the morning. TV in perfect working order, lovely soap etc. and nice towels. Nothing fancy, but we don't need fancy as much as quiet and a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Finished off our trip perfectly”
Reviews.Author: Umba
Reviews.Content: So glad this was our last stop before returning home. It really is the perfect little place in a very nice area. We loved our room and the fact that you could park your car right outside for free. The complimentary continental breakfast was good as were the afternoon cookies & tea. There is also a great little patio area adjacent to reception with a water feature where you can enjoy breakfast. All the staff were really helpful especially the lovely John who we really enjoyed chatting to. Kerry & Maria (the English!)

Reviews.Title: “a great choice near ucla campus”
Reviews.Author: REB04
Reviews.Content: We recently had the pleasure to stay at The Brentwood Inn for our daughter's graduation from UCLA. All of the staff were exceptionally kind and helpful. They all deserve kudos for excellent customer service! The rooms are not particularly large but they are well appointed, clean and the mattresses are the most comfortable I have ever had at a hotel. The free parking is great-right outside the room's front door and the free continental breakfast has an ample selection and hit the spot. I definitely recommend The Brentwood Inn for anyone looking for good value,comfort and superb front desk service!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: perseus9
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel. Here for some business and college tours with my son, and this hotel was exceptional on every level. The bed and linens were plush and crisp, the room impeccably clean, and the bath towels large and comfy. Large flat screen wiht huge channel selection and wifi are a given these days, so for me it's all about extremely clean rooms wiht high quality linens and towels - none of the cheapy hotel chain stuff. With the door shut, it's exceptionally quiet, good for the one morning we slept in. Breakfast was also very lovely, no Farmer's Bros coffee here! Can't wait for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Inn - Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: DebMelbourne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned home after spending a week at The Brentwood Inn. The Inn is in Brentwood which makes it relatively close to Santa Monica etc.. The rooms are a little on the small side but they are well equipped, clean and comfortable. We were delighted to find that there is on site parking at the Brentwood Inn and it's free! What really made our stay wonderful is the staff at The Brentwood Inn. Everyone from housekeepers to the Reception staff were great. We were so happy with all the Reception Staff; they are extremely polite and very helpful. They go out of their way to make their guests feel at home. We stayed in a front room which was nice but a little noisy due to the traffic. In future, we would probably book a room at the rear of the Inn. A free continental style breakfast was available to guests in the morning which was a nice touch. Overall, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at Brentwood Inn”
Reviews.Author: DJR43
Reviews.Content: We booked the Brentwood Inn based on reviews from Trip Advisor and were NOT disappointed. The location was in the suburbs but convenient to public transportation. Although our room was on the small side, it was very clean and comfortable. The staff, especially Evan and Britton, were quite friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. The continental breakfast was very good. We would highly recommend this hotel. Ottawa, Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Clean And Quiet In A Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: lholmberg
Reviews.Content: The suite we had was medium-sized, extremely clean, quiet, stylishly decorated with a high quality mattress. Top-notch customer service from front desk. Parking spaces are of good size but overall lot design requires a little manuvering when exiting lot. Front desk recommended Pizzacoto(as I recall) which was about a mile away...great, smaller Italian place. The route is walkable should you choose.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Must come!”
Reviews.Author: Gorlendo
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. I must give cheers to the staff especially the front desk. They are the definition of good services! Rooms are on the small side but they are spotless and feel very homey. Great Job on the lobby, wifi Internet, breakfast and the little court yard beside the lobby. I also like how the rooms are super close to your parking. The only down side is the noise. I stayed in the room closest to the road so you can hear a little bit of traffic noise, but it wasn't a big deal. Keep the windows close and you will be fine. All in all what a great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “We Love it!!”
Reviews.Author: dreamfishy
Reviews.Content: Great Stay!!! This is a little inn with everything needed (WiFi, good continental breakfast..)Very cute and clean place with great services!!! It is close to most tourist attractions in LA. Will come back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific secret spot you will love.....”
Reviews.Author: PalmSpringsDiva*
Reviews.Content: I used to pass this place when I lived in LA and often wondered what it was like; it's old, like maybe from the "50's but has been TOTaLLy renovated in a great way considering they are NOT large rooms. The location is perfect; very safe and run in a spectacular way. All the "helpers" are smart, gracious and efficient. The price is not bad, while comparable to Angeleno down the street, but it's a whole different animal. It's small, quaint, sweet, immaculate and has a warm, friendly ambience; parking is right outside your door. There is a hidden courtyard to have breakfast in and read your morning paper; a nice little continental plus breakfast type morning fare is free. The room and bath are kind of smallish but adequate and actually fun; the tv is great, twin beds adequate and we loved it. A little tricky on ingress and egress during traffic hours but manageable. Worth it for an interesting experience and location. We truly enjoyed our stay. Could be romantic with the right person too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: ronrush
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because parking and Wi-Fi is free. They also offer free breakfast and tea. You definitely need a car if you are staying in his hotel, and I really like the idea that the car is just at my doorstep. I would have rated it 5 stars for service (trust me, the guys are really friendly and nice), but it is getting a 3 stars because they continued to charge me for the first night which I didn't make it - even though I had a valid reason because my flight was cancelled in Tokyo due to the earthquake on 11th March and only arrived a day later. They did not explain to me why I have to be charged even though I did not stay for the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! Your prepaid reservation may be cancelled.”
Reviews.Author: sunnie77
Reviews.Content: I have never written a negative review because I have used TripAdvisor for over six years (even have a cap given to early members) for travel all over Europe and the USA, and I rely routinely on the reviews. Therefore, I was shocked to receive such shabby treatment from Brentwood Inn which has received mostly good reviews. After booking a reservation by phone almost five weeks before my stay, I immediately received an email confirmation. Shortly afterwards, when I received my credit card bill I was surprised to see my card had been charged immediately for the one-night stay. Sure enough, when I went back to the email confirmation there was an attachment which was a receipt for the charge, showing a zero balance owing. Okay, that is different from the other hotels/motels I have experienced for any trip and for the week-long road trip in southern California which included Brentwood Inn. In fact, I have never been charged in advance unless the rate was a special on-line advance payment rate. (This was a phone reservation, remember?) Later, on the day of my stay, I called Brentwood Inn out of courtesy in the mid-afternoon from a nearby museum because I would not be checking in until about 6 p.m. after the museum closed. I was greeted cheerfully on the phone and told they had been trying to reach me because they had to cancel my reservation and place me in a hotel several miles away in the opposite direction of my trip! That,of course, was unacceptable, and after a very serious discussion, the refund I demanded was promised. Sure enough, when I returned home, there were two phone messages: One was left one day before I was to check in, saying, "Please call us to confirm your reservation. We are running tight." The other message was left the morning of my reservation, " We are running very tight. Please call us." Three business days after the cancellation my credit card was credited with the refund after Brentwood Inn used my money without interest for five weeks. What kind of baloney is this? Recall the tour company back East several years ago which was prosecuted for collecting early reservations, then cancelling close to the tour departure because they were booking folks on a wait list who were willing to pay more expensive tour prices booked at the last minute. This kind of business operation must be stopped.

Reviews.Title: “Great for location, rates and staff.”
Reviews.Author: silvascreen
Reviews.Content: Spent eleven days here while taking a ton of meetings all over town. The room was very comfortable, with some good touches. (Aveda toiletries, decent TV, quality linens.) Handy location. Santa Monica, West Hollywood, Culver City and Beverly Hills all in easy reach. Burbank and Studio City more of a trek. Mind you, being on Sunset, the traffic is on the busy side. The friendly staff are incredibly obliging. And, as an Englishman in LA, I would have been lost without Evan's knowledgeable travel advice and maps. The complimentary afternoon tea and biscuits were also welcome after a busy day. The rates are very reasonable. (With discount for an extended stay.) However, there are no facilities -- ie Bar, Restaurant, Pool, etc. Not a problem for me, and San Vicente Bld - restaurants, shops, coffeehouses - is a pleasant ten minute walk. Overall, for the price, very good.

Reviews.Title: “upscale motel, great location”
Reviews.Author: GodisLoveDenver
Reviews.Content: Servic was great. Brittian & Evan really took care of us and helped to make our stay enjoyable. Our room (#443) had a king bed and was very comfortable (firm). Room was a little tight on space but overall clean and pleasant. Location is tops for West LA, Brentwood, and Santa Monica. There's really no other places around that are this close to Brentwood Village.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, Clean, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: jetaged
Reviews.Content: I'm definitely a fan of the Brentwood Inn. It's a step back in time to the days of roadside 'Motor Inns' of the 30's, 40's & 50's, but very nicely updated and appointed. Pluses: ~Very friendly and accommodating staff ~Good rates ~Clean and nicely appointed (flat screen T.V., coffee maker in room, calm color scheme) ~Parking right in front of your room included! (huge plus) ~Free WiFi ++! Minuses: ~Small bathrooms (but very clean and updated) ~Rooms on the Kenter/Bundy side definitely get some traffic noise and I've not yet been offered a quieter room on the other side of the property All in all, I have been super happy with this place and look forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Lu_and_Pete
Reviews.Content: Recently had a brief one night stay at the Brentwood Inn in transit from Las Vegas to a road trip on the Pacific Highway. The gentleman who checked us in was extremely friendly and helpful, showing us to our room and demonstrating how the heating worked. We were also offered complimentary cookies and milk on arrival. The man who checked us out the next morning was equally helpful, giving us some tips for our road trip. Breakfast wasn't included, however we bought some tasty muffins quite cheaply from reception in the morning. There is a cosy lounge area near reception which looked like a good place for guests to mingle. Our room was clean and comfortable, with the nice little touches of an independent hotel (e.g. Aveda toiletries and a proper hairdryer). It was on the small side, and a little noisy during the night, perhaps because our room faced the road. Parking was right out the front of our room which was very convenient. Great location and would be a good base for a trip to explore LA. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and was sorry not to enjoy a longer stay!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful, clean -- pleasant and positive experience”
Reviews.Author: mpellow
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and tidy, and the staff were unfailingly pleasant and helpful, especially with restaurant suggestions and directions down to Santa Monica. Perfect for a quick stopover and would gladly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service”
Reviews.Author: PackmanD
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here Dec 7-9. Good, clean rooms in a great location (quiet, out by West Hollywood). Staff were very friendly and accommodating going out of their way to help - it was appreciated. Breakfast included was largely pedestrian (only yoghurt/coffee/juice/pastries) but there were plenty of places nearby to get a full breakfast so no real con...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, good location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Tripwilmington
Reviews.Content: This is an updated motel in Brentwood. Very friendly staff, good value no parking fees for LA. Rooms are small but very well decorated. Easy in and out to I 405. The staff couldn't do enough to help us, warm cookies in the afternoon with milk, that type of place. Try to book rooms on the inside as the location is on Sunset Blvd. which is busy at times.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless Service - Charming Staff”
Reviews.Author: technotrend
Reviews.Content: I travel to L.A. often and normally stay on the West Side. I have driven passed The Brentwood Inn many times, and when doing so I would make a mental note to check it out some day. The hotel is located in a quaint residential neighborhood, but still convenient to the 405 Fwy, and other main roads and attractions. I finally booked a stay, and all I can say is WOW! The property and rooms are well maintained, beds are comfortable, and the service is by far the best I've experienced in L.A I highly recommend it! All of the staff is very helpful, and they go out of their way to make you feel welcome. And, it seems genuine (a rarity in L.A.) John was particularly helpful, and charming too. Thanks, John.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot to explore L.A.”
Reviews.Author: Jlesh8
Reviews.Content: The location, price, and amentities of this inn are unbeatable for L.A. I would describe the Brentwood Inn as a combination of a B & B and upscale motel. Located within a couple miles of Brentwood, UCLA, and Bel Air to the east and Santa Monica and the coast to the west. Extrememly nice and helpful employees. I would absolutely recommend the Brentwood Inn for anyone wishing to have an on the go trip in L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Great in every way!”
Reviews.Author: HappyHolidaysIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights initially and because it was so nice, we actually returned for a further 2 nights to complete our Californian road trip. The Inn is small and you are treated as an important guest, Evan does everything he can to make your stay comfortable, from planning the best way to get to the airport, booking taxis, advising on restaurants and even giving hints on celebrity spotting. He is a gentleman and the Inn is well worth a stay. They offer very good value for money, tell them Ciara sent you!

Reviews.Title: “incredible service”
Reviews.Author: EileenBangkok
Reviews.Content: We found the Brentwood Inn through the UCLA website. The rooms are very nicely furnished and I like that you can park for free right outside your room. It feels more like coming home than staying at a hotel. The hotel is a short drive from UCLA, Pepperdine and Santa Monica. The best thing about this hotel is the staff. The service is above and beyond. I've traveled a lot for business and leisure in the USA and throughout the world but have never experienced such friendly and courteous staff. I am blown away. Thanks John! Don't forget to eat an ice cream sandwich at Diddy Reise for me next time you go! Eileen and Tay

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service, nice, clean and well cared for rooms”
Reviews.Author: ramrom32124
Reviews.Content: We were greeting on our arrival by a gracious manager offering us cookies and cold drinks. The hotel/motel is an older building from the 40s that has been redone and is very well kept. Our room was clean and well equiped and it was evident that great care is spent on little details and making sure it keeps its luster. Breakfast was very nice and plentiful. Most of all, each individual working the desk was extraordinarily courteous and helpful. Our room was way in the back of the lot, with a private little patio. It is possible to walk into Brentwood in about 20 minutes, because car driving during the afternoon is horrendous. We can very highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a quaint, cute jewel of a boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kanek
Reviews.Content: We loved it! Fabulous little hotel with quaint cozy rooms. We can't wait to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DMilo46
Reviews.Content: For anyone looking for a place to stay in pricey L.A. the Brentwood Inn is a good alternative to the more well-known chains. Though it's certainly not luxurious, the hotel is very clear and well-maintained with amenities that matter to us, like constantly replenished towels, shampoo and other emoluments in the rooms and a very adequate continental breakfast in the morning. In addition, the staff is incredibly helpful and friendly, will make reservations and in general do everything possible to make one's stay pleasant. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The best option for international tourists”
Reviews.Author: renatadecourt
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in the Brentwood Inn! The room was very confortable and very clean. As we are from Brazil we were about to make some mistakes as we didn't know the city at all. The manager and employees of the hotel were really kind everytime, helping us to plan the schedule considering the traffic and weather, giving directions (sometimes the GPS confuses us) and helping out with car rental and also info's on how to get Lakers tickets. They made everything much easier to us and in a very friendly environment. I strongly recommend! I read some reviews here before the travel and I have to say that all the good things that the other reviews say is true.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is truly great people”
Reviews.Author: LUU7777
Reviews.Content: I had a great time during my stay at this Inn. The people who work there are just very nice, very helpful. And they dont even want to be tipped for it! I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Going to L.A. for a night or two - The Brentwood Inn is a must!”
Reviews.Author: CherFMN
Reviews.Content: Having been born & raised in L.A. - I am particular where to stay and conscientious of price, especially parking AND the noise factor. I considered West Hollywood and Santa Monica; kept on researching and found The Brentwood Inn on Sunset Blvd. just west of Barrington. For a short visit, as the rooms are small (like NYC rooms), this hotel is wonderful! The rooms have been nicely renovated, appointed with the right amenities from the sheets to the towels - and the staff is incredibly personable and attentive! They even offer afternoon snacks and a nice breakfast that you can take on the run. Loved it, loved it, loved it! Thank you Brentwood Inn - Cher

Reviews.Title: “Recommended...with reservations”
Reviews.Author: homesick_and_grumpy
Reviews.Content: One thing about Trip Advisor reviews: when people like a place, they tend to heap excessive praise on it. This seems to be the case with The Brentwood Inn, a very nice place indeed, but not for everyone. The Brentwood Inn is a very tidy little motor lodge nestled in the least likely of places - the tony Brentwood neighborhood of Los Angeles. The only reason the Inn still sits alone in this residential area is that it was grandfathered into the zoning laws, having predated them by a number of years. The Inn has been a motor lodge since the 1940's, and therein lies its charm and some of its drawbacks. Because of said zoning, the owners are not allowed to replace the original structures, they can only improve and update them. The result is a smallish classic motor inn with modern amenities. Rooms are on the compact side, but clean white with neutral shading. Windows all have classic white wooden shutters. The original wooden peak ceiling is intact, with a skylight added. One wall is painted brick. There’s a nice flatscreen TV with plenty of channels (no in-room movies), a comfortable bed with soft pillows, and a dresser/desk combo with free, no-hassle, wireless internet (and very good connectivity, I might add). Each room is equipped with a refrigerator, coffeemaker, iron and half-sized ironing board (why oh why?? Hotel owners should be forced to try ironing anything on one of these nightmares before equipping their rooms with them). The bathroom - true to the Inn’s vintage - is small but tidy, with white tiles and classic fixtures. There was no bath in my room, only a shower. One morning it took 15 minutes for the hot water to kick in, certainly not the most green-friendly of set-ups. Everyone - from the desk staff to the housekeeping - is friendly and helpful. The place is unquestionably cheery. Breakfast - cold cereal or pastries, juice and coffee - is free every morning, and you can enjoy it on their sunny little patio. Why people think The Brentwood Inn is good for families is beyond me; rooms are small and there is absolutely nothing for children to do here except watch TV. Another caveat: The Inn is adjacent to a firehouse. While I didn’t find it intrusive, you WILL hear sirens, a few every day. As for convenience, there’s a lot to be said for having your car parked right outside your room: no valet, no waiting. But to clarify those who say the Inn is convenient to everything in L.A., you should know the following: Places you’ll be near: The O.J. Crime Scene The 405 The Getty Center Santa Monica Santa Monica State Beach Pacific Coast Highway (Malibu) UCLA Westwood Places you’ll be adjacent to: Beverly Hills Culver City Places you’ll be nowhere near: Hollywood Dodger Stadium Universal City downtown Los Angeles Burbank Glendale Pasadena All told, I liked The Brentwood Inn, a lot, and I’d not hesitate to return there. That said, it’s not for everyone. If you are used to hotel amenities - room service, movies, spa, store, in-house gym, etc. - you won’t find them here. If you’re intrepid, a careful driver (the parking lot is tiny!), without children, and in search of a comfortable room in a good location, this could very well be your home away from home in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Rickalex
Reviews.Content: Of the 9 nights we spent in Southern California, 4 of the best we're spent at the Brentwood Inn. The staff couldn't have been more sweet, accommodating, helpful and pleasant. They spoiled us. At the next hotel in Laguna Beach, the staff seemed not to care whether we were there or not. They actually acted annoyed when we asked questions. At the Brentwood, the loved it when we asked for help or suggestions. Whenever we are in LA, we will certainly be returning to the Brentwood Inn, Great location, very comfortable, perfect. They deserve the accolades they are receiving. We have already recommended it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: donnabada
Reviews.Content: I was really happy with my short stay at the hotel. The staff went out of the way to be accommodating. The location and the room was very nice. I would return there the next time I stay in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place close to the highlights within being fully in them”
Reviews.Author: Trav_Pullach
Reviews.Content: We spend four nights. Perfect place on Sunset Blvd, close to the museums, Santa Monica beach, Hollywood, Beverly Hills within being too close. Very friendly, got a lot of nice infos what to do, nice outside breakfast area, very clean rooms. Will take the place again when back in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, attention to detail, clean, well-appointed”
Reviews.Author: Inkygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were visiting my father-in-law, who lives in L.A. We had been staying in a lower-cost hotel downtown, but decided to end our trip in a slightly more upscale place; we found The Brentwood Inn through TripAdvisor. We stayed in Room 446. I'm SO glad we decided to stay at The Brentwood Inn. The office staff (Elisabeth and Evan) were friendly, courteous, helpful, and knowledgeable about the area. Our rooms were clean and exactly what we had hoped for: comfortable, elegantly designed, and well-appointed. Amenities included Aveda shampoo, conditioner, lotion and soap, plus a makeup remover pad, vanity kit (cotton balls, Q-tips), and a small tube of toothpaste. The fridge had two bottles of water, and there was a coffeemaker and coffee (you could get coffee and tea anytime by the front desk). There was no bathtub, just a shower, but the water pressure was good and we never ran out of hot water. Everything seemed solidly constructed, and we never heard our neighbours. The rooms included Wifi -- we were warned upfront that Wifi is a bit unstable sometimes, but we were provided with a cable to use in case we had problems; we ended up using the cable and were able to access the Internet with no problem. For those without computers, there was also a laptop connected to the Internet for use by Brentwood visitors in the reception area. Breakfast included a selection of pastries, muffins, fruit, yogurt, instant oatmeal, milk and juice, coffee and tea. You could eat in the small sitting area in the reception area, or outside on the patio beside a lovely wall fountain. There was also a basket of chocolate-oatmeal bars on the front reception desk. If you were short on reading material, you could pick up something to read from a small selection of books in the reception area. It was a pleasant change to be able to pick up some fruit or a granola bar whenever I felt like it; I'm so used to places where you have to pay for every little thing. Though we didn't have time to use it, there was also a nice little outdoor seating area near our room, with two small tables and some chairs; the candles were lit in the evenings. My husband and I are definitely coming back!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent 'home from home' Hotel/Motel”
Reviews.Author: matt_from_nottingham
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days after Boxing Day and a very long flight to LAX. On arriving we were offered free soft drinks, water and other goodies. A very, very warm welcome. The room was quite basic, but very clean with fridge, shower, large TV, but no bath. The breakfast in the morning was a buffet affair but pleasant. With plenty of car parking space and ideally located I'l certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a Find!”
Reviews.Author: beezerTn
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place to stay close to UCLA as we were on a trip looking at colleges. UCLA actually recommended The Brentwood Inn, and after reading the reviews here, I booked directly through the property. I could not have been more pleased- a great location (10 minutes from UCLA and Malibu- yet in a very nice, quiet neighborhood), free parking, wonderful staff and cozy rooms that include continental breakfast and bottled water, soft drinks, and tea/coffee all day. The front desk staff printed out maps for all the many directions that we asked for, gave excellent restaurant suggestions, and genuinely seemed happy to help in any way. We have traveled all over the world, and while the big chain hotels serve a purpose, it is so nice to run across a small inn run by people who take great pride in their product. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service & very confortable bed!”
Reviews.Author: potemkine
Reviews.Content: The B&B is in a perfect location on Sunset Boulevard. It is 15min away from Santa Monica / Malibu / Beverly Hills and in a posh neighbourhood. I would recommend a room on the back (where we were) as the hotel is facing the busy boulevard. The room was quiet, very clean and had an extremely comfortable bed with soft bedlinens! The service at the front desk was really outstanding: they were helping you out for absolutely everything with an extreme kindness. I would go back again! Only thing they could do to improve themselves is to add a shelf for the cosmetics in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Our sanctuary in LA”
Reviews.Author: ahetzel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I used to live about a half mile away from the Brentwood Inn 3 years ago and now return to the Los Angeles area regularly (every few months) for business and to visit friends. We always prefer to stay at the Brentwood Inn whenever possible. The rooms are simple, comfortable and tastefully decorated, staff and owners always very accommodating, and the location is among our favorite in all of LA -- within walking distance to Brentwood Village and a short ride to Santa Monica. Note that the parking is tight (as it is in most of West LA), so a smaller rental car is advisable and if you are looking for a large Disney-fied resort for your noisy children to run wild, this is not the place for you. The Brentwood Inn is truly our home away from home, whenever we return to Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra-comfortable night in a crazy city”
Reviews.Author: dividedsky123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family recently and it was wonderful. Small, intimate, quiet, very comfortable. Thought the rooms might be a little small, but the room I shared with my brother was ideal. Gracious, helpful staff that is never in-your-face, but always has many suggestions on how to see Los Angeles the way the locals do. Free parking, breakfast, and internet access too. A complete value. Forget all those places in Los Angeles where you are treated rudely and you sleep uncomfortably--stay here instead!

Reviews.Title: “Better than any Hollywood Bungalow in LA!!”
Reviews.Author: bruizer
Reviews.Content: The Brentwood Motor Inn has been a fixture in our family now for over 30 years, with plenty of family and friends staying there. Last year I had to return to LA and the staff of the Brentwood Motor Inn (COMPLETELY and incredibly tastefully redone inside and out!), and stayed at the Motor Inn for 2 days. It has been completely and tastefully redone and now the rooms inside look more like something you'd see in Conde Nast's Traveler magazine, or in a high end Hollywood Bungalow tucked away in the Hills and charging double or triple the price. The Brentwood Inn, IS a little pricey but you get what you pay for and MORE from the Brentwood Inn! They have a GREAT and constantly refilled breakfast buffet and due to my travel circumstances the staff was nice enough to let me check in at noon on a weekend AND I got BETTER than the AAA discounted rate! The staff are both solicitous and helpful for those who do not know LA's sprawling freeways and always willing to print out directions for you from their very nice office. The Wi-Fi service and BIG SCREEN TV's in each room are a welcome change from even the 32" TV's in upscale motel rooms. My room had a 42" LCD TV mounted above the wall which was wonderful to watch college football on while working on my laptop. The night before I checked in I stayed in a $120 a night place in Santa Monica. TOTAL NIGHTMARE. The Brentwood Inn is like a little idyllic spot where you can close the SOUND PROOFED DOORS and shut the world out for a little while. I got my ONLY good sleep in LA at the Brentwood Inn and I've stayed all over LA from the $120 a night place before to the $800 a night per room Mondrian (this was awhile ago :-), and I lived in LA for over 20 years. For the peace, the quiet, the wonderful service and the simple respite and the wonderful breakfast in the morning. They put out GOOD muffins and cereal, fresh fruit, etc. Not your cheapo standard motel buffet and everything is FRESH. My ONLY caveat might be if you have kids. Book TWO rooms adjacent to each other so the kids can have one if you want or save this place as your idyllic get away for two! Again the SAME family has run this property for over 30 years and it has been redone both tastefully and wonderfully with only the little bobble here and there. New paint, new beds, new EVERYTHING. STAY HERE before it gets booked up or found out about! They have EVERY service including fax you might need, reasonable, for LA, rates, and the Brentwood Inn is probably the MOST CONVENIENT place to stay IF you're going to be mostly in West LA. And it's the ONLY place to stay that's actually in Brentwood. The diff between staying at the Brentwood Inn, which used to be your run of the mill family owned motel, and now is something MUCH NICER and much more opulent and extravagant, is that at any chain or anyplace else on the Westside of LA you can get a decent room for around the same price (ALL of LA is expensive now I found out on my last 3 visits:-). The difference is staying at the Brentwood Motor Inn is an EXPERIENCE. One NOT to be missed. The room was NICER than my own bedroom at home and changed my mind about going out and buying an LCD TV as well!, the rooms are VERY, good sized, nice BIG bathroom with all NEW fixtures (outer molding on my bathroom window could have used some fresh white paint but it's outside after all) and the beds are firm and NEW and so are ALL the fixtures and it looks like they had a VERY GOOD interior deceorator design the theme for the rooms. Probably the NICEST most tastefully decorated rooms this side of the Mauna Kea imho. You get what you pay for and this is definitely worth it for a long weekend or even a week in LA. If you're doing the usual tourist things like Knotts Berry or Disneyland you're going to want to stay someplace closer to those areas, but if you want to be in trendy and veddy chic West LA and be approx. 5 minutes from a freeway entrance that will take you anywhere in LA, this should be your "temporary home". It's 100x nicer than the similiarly priced motels in the area or down in Santa Monica. STAY AWAY from some of the beachfront Santa Monica motels. They SOUND good, but you'll be hearing foot traffic until 2 am on a regular night as well as cars and the normal people screaming on a weekend in Santa Monica. I endured a night of this before checking in to the Inn and got the FIRST decent sleep I'd had since arriving in LA 3 days ago. Those sound proof doors REALLY work and you can shut the world out and then go out when you're ready. The Inn really is a little Oasis amongst the madness that is LA. Hope this helped. 2 Thumbs WAY UP!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds the Gold Standard for Customer Serice”
Reviews.Author: Chris S
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a quick business trip where I stayed at The Brentwood Inn. From beginning to end, Kanuja did everything she could to make my stay the best possible - checking me in early, offering refreshments when she learned that I hadn't had lunch, suggesting things to do, printing out my boarding pass, and being so polite. I even got a message saying that there had been a wake-up call request that they thought was left over from the previous guest. They cancelled it but asked that I call back if I still wanted the wake-up call. The room was clean, comfortable, and very 21st century with the plasma TV, remote control for HVAC, a two-alarm clock radio, and a high-tech system for preventing folks from leaving the lights on when leaving the room. I agree that the bathroom, at least in my room, was on the small side, but it was fine for the single traveler. Even the shower had its own ventilation system. Plus there were mirrors galore, and free high-speed Internet access in the room (they'll supply Ethernet cables if you don't have one). I really enjoyed the continental breakfast, especially since there was my favorite - oatmeal! The location was quiet and within walking distance of both nice neighborhoods where you can safely get some exercise and the farmers' market on Sunday mornings. Normally, I stay in the Westwood area, but I will definitely The Brentwood Inn to my list. This former motor lodge has been in the family for two decades, and they definitely know how to treat guests like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience at the Brentwood!”
Reviews.Author: dhowng
Reviews.Content: Truly a rare find in the heart of Los Angeles! We booked a large reservation for a UCLA conference and were more than pleased by how convenient and elegant the hotel was. In short, we could never have survived without JC and his incredible staff!

Reviews.Title: “a true gem”
Reviews.Author: yooka
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the brentwood inn for a month while on business. Kanuja and JC, the owners, are an absolute delight. They have put their heart and soul into making sure every single detail of your visit is perfect. If you need something, ANYTHING, they will find a way to get it to you. They removed the feather bedding in my room before I even arrived and replaced it with down-alternative. They even went so far as to place a hepa air filter in my room (I have bad allergies). Talk about service?!!!!! I have never met such kind, generous, helpful people in my life! The rooms are impeccably clean and pretty with great beds, linens, a plasma tv, fresh flowers and mini fridge. My favorite part was my corner room, having lots of windows I could open-- it felt like home! oh wait- maybe it was the aveda products that are replenished daily?!! Every morning they have a little buffet of fresh muffins, croissants, danishes, oatmeal, yogurt and fruit along with teas and coffee. Right off the lobby/front office there is a pretty little patio with cute smith and hawken furniture and a little water fall where you can enjoy your breakfast and read the NY times in the sun. After breakfast you can talk a long walk in the nice surrounding neighborhoods. I truly felt like I was at home here-- I practically was after a month!! The Brentwood Inn is a true gem in such a busy city- Thanks again Kanuja, JC, and Evan, you guys are amazing ! Namaste my friends :) hope to see you again one day! steph

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: blanche_d
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Brentwood Inn recently while we were in town for a wedding. We were looking for a reasonably priced hotel, and a family member recommended the Brentwood. We were thrilled with the hotel's location (minutes from Santa Monica and a beautiful drive up highway 1 to Malibu), clean (though slighly small) rooms, and a fantastically helpful and welcoming staff. We highly recommend it, and will certainly be back ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay but Overpriced for a Cute Little Motor Inn”
Reviews.Author: Siempre_Italia
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Good location in West LA/Brentwood - Rooms are very clean and the bedroom area is decorated in a soothing minimalist way - Housekeeping did an excellent job and also responded to our small requests - Helpful staff Cons: - Very cramped rooms with small closet area. It’s better suited for a solo business traveler than a couple due to the tight layout. We were constantly saying “excuse me” just to get by each other. - Bathrooms are also pretty narrow with a pocket door. There is only a tiled shower stall with a timer (would feel more spacious glassed-in). Our shower ceiling fan directly overhead had what looked like some reddish mold or rust beyond the plastic ducts. - Room can get very stuffy unless the AC is run. Recommended upgrades: - Completely cover or remove skylight to better darken bedroom in the early mornings - Update showerhead to adjustable version instead of fixed and update old shower handle fixtures. - Needs dual pane windows and curtains to block out noises/sirens from Sunset Blvd and light from outside. - Continental breakfast of baked goods could include yogurt and/or fresh fruit The Brentwood Inn was decent, but for an average of the mid to upper 200’s per night, next time we’ll definitely be staying elsewhere at more spacious nearby options we had contemplated that have a similar aesthetic and accommodation amenities in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: nanosmom
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Brentwood Inn. The room was comfortable, clean, and tastefully furnished with great attention to detail. The location was terrific - within walking distance to wonderful restaurants and convenient to the freeway. Free internet access , complimentary breakfast, and bottled water to start the day were great , too. What made our stay truly exceptional was the amazing hospitality offered by the management and staff, who made us feel welcome and cared for during our entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Brentwood Inn: A welcome respite.”
Reviews.Author: sophiejay
Reviews.Content: The Brentwood Inn is a welcome respite from the usual hotel chain mentality in guest services. We recently stayed for three nights and Canuja and J.C. were extremely gracious and accomodating during our stay. Continental breakfast and afternoon tea, cookies and fruit served in the lobby allowed interaction with the wonderful staff and fellow guests. The neighborhood location offers destinations within walking distance. Yes, we did miss having a pool, but the entire stay was so pleasant we'll return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Brentwood”
Reviews.Author: Vic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Brentwood from the 15th May till 20th May. We had a great stay. The Brentwood Inn is situated in a wealthy area of Los Angeles where many stars have their homes. Unfortunately we didn't spot any! We felt safe in the area and were able to walk around at any time of day. The Inn is about a 15 minute walk to the centre of Brentwood where there are shops and restaurants including the Cheesecake Factory. The Brentwood Inn is conviently located to visit the main tourist attractions in LA and is also only a 10 minute drive to Santa Monica. The Brentwood Inn is geared towards the business traveller. The rooms are small but immaculate and with a very modern feel. The owners of the Inn are incredibly helpful and go out their way to answer questions and offer suggestions of things to do. There is a complimentary breakfast which consists of muffins and pastries, tea and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LITTLE GEM WITH HEART AND SOUL”
Reviews.Author: tonitravels
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Brentwood for a month while consulting with a medical specialist in LA. The hotel was recommended by the Doctor who is located in Brentwood. This little gem of an inn is run by an intelligent, charming and entertaining young couple who live on site. The Inn is a true reflection of it's loving owners. The owners have instilled their values of unending graciousness to the small staff, and there is not an unfriendly face on the premises. At checkin I was greeted by name, warmly welcomed with organic teas and fresh baked cookies and instructed on the best places to dine that night. along with what I should do the next morning. (including visit the local farmers market, a one block walk). Both of the owners who frequently man the reception area and the two young staff members treat the positon as a cross between a 5 star consierge service and the best tips from a true local. I don't think it is possible to make a request that the owners have not already anticipated and provided for. Due to the friendliness of the owners and staff the lobby is the central gathering place for this Inn. The lobby reflects the warmth of the management with dark hardwoodfloors, catherdral ceilings, a stone fireplace, comfortable furnishings, the LA and NewYork Times for leisure perusal, and a wireless MAC computer for visitor use. -Mornings are spent over muffins, croissants, fruit, juice, milk, coffee and teas in this lovely setting or outside on the stone patio wifh seating and a waterfall for a rather zen like atmosphere. The rooms are small but cozy with great beds, an abudndance of pillows, fabulous linens,. The wood beamed catherdral ceililngs make them feel more spacious and the lighting is very thoughtfully designed. This hotel under the guidance of it's young owners recently underwent a major renovation and more improvements are in process. While I was staying at the Brentwood new large flat screen TVs were installed for perfect bed viewing. Knowing that I was a football fan looking forward to the superbowl, the owners made sure my new TV was installed the morning of the superbowl! How much better can serviced get. I understand that new furniture was also in production and may even be in place now. Everything is neat clean and well cared for. The location is perfect, tucked into the residential neighborhood of Brentwood and within easy walking distance to tons of area restruanants and Boutiques. And you could not stay with nicer people.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Terrific owners and staff!”
Reviews.Author: GaryDelaware
Reviews.Content: I had an very enjoyable stay at this hotel. I was there for 5 days and really appreciated the fact that I could walk though an attractive neighborhood to get to stores, shops and restaurants. The owners and staff are very friendly and exceptionally helpful with directions, things to see and places to go. My room was very clean and comfortable.
