I don't spend a lot of time hanging around my room when I travel and it was great to be near major attractions without feeling like you are in a crowded area of town. LA is hectic enough without having your hotel stuck in the middle of the bustle. This hotel is in a nice residential area only 10 minutes from the Getty museum and 5 minutes to Rt 405. Malibu is only a 25 minute drive away. If you travel a lot you'll appreciate this place.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but otherwise ideal”
Reviews.Author: DougP
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here three times. Once pre-renovation when it was a very basic and inexpensive older motel, once mid-renovation when things were looking up, and last month after most of their renovation was complete. In many ways it's an ideal place to stay, IMO. It's in a nice neighborhood, location is pretty good right on Sunset with the 405 close by. The Getty center is 10 minutes away. You can get checked in and out quickly, no fuss, easy parking. Rooms are straightforward and nice, no excess. This is not a 4 star hotel. There are basically no amenities. It's a nice place to sleep, not to hang out. Breakfast is decent - coffee, fruit, muffins and croissants, juice if you ask for it. The owners are nice and helpful. Fridge in the room is a plus. I don't like big huge hotels with parking hassles, annoying staff in my face, etc. And a lot of the smaller/chain motels in LA tend to be crappy and poorly located. This place bridges the gap. The downside - it is overpriced, although I recenly got 4 nights for $159 though this was mid week. It can also get noisy in the morning with Sunset traffic nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure I agree with the other reviews ....”
Reviews.Author: KD1
Reviews.Content: Not sure I agree with the last couple of reviews regarding The Brentwood. Sure, the one staff member that spoke to me on check in was very friendly. When my husband checked in a day later to meet up with me he was told there was no booking under our name, so that was a bit of a challenge for him to get into our room. ( we had no mobiles to contact each other) The breakfast is nothing special - a couple of muffins and a couple of apples is not exactly what I thought would greet me. The water feature - sure, it is certainly very nice, especially if you enjoy the traffic noises coming from behind it. As far os each "bungalow" being separate - this isn't entirely true - they are all connected like a motel. AND lastly, the sky light - they really should consider getting rid of these - the light shining in the room in the morning is very painful if you want to have a bit of a sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Brentwood”
Reviews.Author: Joltin_Joe
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this little property weekly ever since I discovered it in June of 2005. Recommended by a business associate, I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else, now. The property is under $200/per night, consistently clean, rooms are charming, the owners work there almost every night and are the nicest young couple you could ever meet. This is a property that says "we really care about your experience " in every way. High Speed internet both cable and wireless (they even provide the cable if needed), refrigerator and coffee maker in every room. Fully tiled cozy bathroom with great shower - instantly hot and good water pressure. Vaulted ceiling and a remote controlled air conditioning unit with amazingly creative features for guest comfort even after you're in bed. Great little continental breakfast with a water featured guest patio for morning and evening relaxation with cookies, hot tea or coffee and fruit in the evenings. Best experience for frequent travelers I have ever found and I have traveled all my life. Just try it once and you'll be hooked. Thanks to the caring and friendly owner/managers; keep up the wonderful experience you have created there!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: happyinca
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Brentwood Inn while visiting the Santa Monica area for one night and had a very pleasant experience there. Each guestroom is a separate bungalow, so it's like you have your own private residence on the grounds -- a nice change from staying in hotels. The room I stayed in was clean and bright. I felt very safe there as a single traveler, and the staff was very friendly and helpful regarding transportation to the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Santa Monica/Brentwood area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Inn”
Reviews.Author: Rohonda
Reviews.Content: The Brentwood Inn is a lovely place. Check in was efficient and friendly with home baked cookies. The staff is truly there to serve you. The only thing I would do different on a return stay is to request a room without the skylight. It's as if a spotlight is shinning down upon you to wake you before you're ready! Otherwise, it's a charming place. After we left we were even telephoned and told we had left an item behind.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: larroyo69
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again. Place is kept clean and staff is more than friendly and knowledgable about surrounding eateries and things to do. If you are a light sleeper it might be too noisy because it's next to the blvd. The only other negative aspect is the skylight. There's no control over the light coming into the skylight on the ceiling. It's annoying in the morning when you're trying to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: misspipsy
Reviews.Content: The Brentwood Inn is an absolute gem. It's nestled in a lovely area along Sunset Boulevard, just a mile west of I-405. The two women working the front office are warm and helpful, as is one of the resident managers who kindly brought an iron to my room at 11:00 one night. My room was very clean and a winning mix of charm and hi-tech. It was a little on the small side, but laid out to maximize space. Though I think some parts of the room would be too snug for two people. My corner room had a skylight, white shutters as blinds, and furnishings in rich colors. Very home-y. A remote control allows guests to adjust the room's climate. The hotel has business travelers in mind, offering free wireless internet, free bottled water, a nice-sized refrigerator, and a desk with a good workspace. Women are also catered to. I appreciated the many useful mirrors and Aveda toiletries, for starters. As a woman traveling alone, I felt secure, even though I usually avoid hotels where rooms open directly onto the parking lot. The free breakfast of muffins, fruit, and coffee/tea fit the bill. The best part was eating breakfast in the small courtyard edged with a long fountain. You'd never guess busy Sunset Boulevard was on the other side of the tall privacy fence. This is really minor, but the only thing I wish I had asked about was a full-sized ironing board. I made do with the table-top one in my room, but later learned I could have requested a full-sized one. I travel to Los Angeles two or three times a year on business and I'll certainly make the Brentwood Inn my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for hospitality at your next lodging, you will find it here. The proprietors are warm, friendly and kind. They graciously try to help me out with whatever needs I have when I arrive. It's a cozy and comfortable little getaway place. Their office serves as the lobby and has a warm fireplace inside with a beautiful waterfall courtyard outside; they serve complimentary cookies and tea in the evenings, and in the morning they offer pastries, fruit and coffee/tea; a perfect place to sit and relax after I take a walk. And all of this comes with a big smile... always! The area around the Inn is great for taking walks and, if you want to, you can even walk to a restaurant of your choice for dinner or whatever. I'm glad I discovered The Brentwood Inn. It's where I always stay when I am in Los Angeles near UCLA.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently while attending activites at UCLA. The hotel was well-managed and charming with a clean, soft-modern feel. Regarding location: it would be difficult to do much better as everything is quite close (including the Getty). This hotel, of course, would not be a good pick for someone seeking a high-energy or party atmosphere. It was a relaxing and enjoyable place to spend time in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little place”
Reviews.Author: LeePee24
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to LA and after a long journey from the airport (due to the traffic which seemed to be a nightmare the whole time we were in LA)we were pleasantly surprised with the Brentwood Inn. It looks quaint from the outside and it was nice to be able to park right outside our room. It was a nice touch that they baked fresh cookies and muffins which were left in Reception and were sooo good. The room was very clean and cosy. If I for some reason ever was to go to LA again then this would be where I would stay as its in a nice area and near enough to Santa Monica for the restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “Such a Treat!”
Reviews.Author: luvit
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a evening at the Brentwood Inn, and it was lovely. We've stayed at many a boutique hotel in LA, and the Inn is by far the best. The hosts are warm and welcoming, and their attention to detail unsurpassed. They have done an excellent job of modernizing the property without sacrificing it's charm. Not only are the rooms sparkling clean and cozy, but the grounds are impeccibly maintained. Nowhere else in the city can you enjoy ALL the perks the Inn has to offer. The (free) parking is right in front of your door, the beds warm and comfy, internet access free. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Only_the_truth
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because of the rave reviews in Tripadvisor. What we got was somewhat disappointing. Hotel (sorry Motel) was easy to find but difficult to get to as it's on the wrong side of road if you are comming from the freeway. Rooms were small and bathroom and shower are minute. We were located on the bottom level and you could hear the rooms above and the stairs outside. Breakfast was a muffin/fruit which you collected from reception. There were no seats there, so you had to take food back to your room. On the plus side the rooms are clean with fridge & coffee facilities and the reception staff are helpfull. It's also close to the Getty Museum (2 miles) and the restaurants in Barrington (1 mile). OK for a stop over but would not recommend for a longer stay. During our holiday we had better rooms for less price in Best Westerns.
